Articles.Content:
bought it today (well, yesterday since it after 12.) and now have built a few rockets, launch and recovered a few items and nauts, and now I can at least put stuff in the orbit I want to unless I screw up the launch badly. Even was able to do a flyby of the Mun with a probe.

Anyways, still lot to learn and I plan to have a lot of fun with this!
Beware traveler, he who begins Kerbal Space Program does not ever leave Kerbal Space Program.

Hello! Welcome aboard!

Congrats on getting into orbit!

Happy launchings!

Thanks!

I was playing the non-sandbox at first, but was totally lost on how to get more science after getting the science points for surviving, suborbital, and Orbital. So then I had fun with the sandbox mode. Of course, once I figured out I was doing something wrong when I launched a Kerbal into helocentric orbit when trying to get into orbit (its a quick change from suborbital to getting high on the orbits, and I had too much Dv on full burn), and so did a crash course in orbital machanics and found out I was doing it all wrong and had overbuilt rockets. Now I am decent at getting stuff into Low (Kerbal?) Orbit. And had fun building a few rockets including one heavy lifter that put the stock station core in a nice 90 degree circular orbit will fuel to spare at about 190k meters. even did a flyby of Mun with a unmanned probe.

And yes, I had failures, a couple failed unmanned orbital burns, a near (<10 k) collision of a probe with my station, launching a Kerbal into solar orbit, and I didn't line up ladders right on one thing I made and Bob went flying into space without a handhold.

I think tonight I will be starting a new save as now I have a concept of what the heck I am doing. Trying to not doing too much wiki and learn from mistakes, but I might need to ask on how to get more science in non-sandbox mode.
